result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew Francis Pribula

defendant.name: Pribula, Andrew Francis
defendant.address: 6520 S Cty Tk D, Hawthorne, WI 54849

records.addlTxt:
11:42 AM Defendant Andrew Francis Pribula not in court. Attorney Nathan M Cockerham in court for Andrew Francis Pribula.  Attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls cases 21CF85, 21CF246, 21CF310, 21TR1436, 1437, 22CF17, 22CF80, 22CF169, and 22CF228. Court notes that there was a request to withdraw. Attorney Cockerham has no information on defendant's nonappearance. Upon defendants failure to appear, State requests warrant and forfeiture of any bond.  Asks for no less than $10,000 cash bail per file when apprehended. Court grants warrants, WI and MN, and forfeiture of any bond previously ordered. 22CF169 was set for jury pretrial. State asks that the trial be taken off the calendar. All cash is forfeited. 22CF169, bail no less than $10,000. Cash bail in no less than $10,000 in each of the felony files.
Attorney Cockerham's request to withdraw is granted. 
Defendant is found in default on citations Standard fines in 22TR1436 and 22TR1437. 60 days to pay.

10:29 AM Defendant Andrew Francis Pribula in court. Attorney Luca Wyschnytzky appears with Defendant.  Attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. Acknowledges receipt, waives reading, asks for status.
Status conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 10:30 am.

11:15 AM Defendant Andrew Francis Pribula in court. Att. Wyshnytzky appears for Att. Cockerham by video. Attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Att Wyshnytzky- Client will waive prelim
Court finds probable cause for bind over, sets arraignment date
Arraignment scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.

1:35 PM Prosecuting attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Andrew Francis Pribula appeared by video, in custody. Defendant indicates that he has retained Attorney Cockerham for other cases and should be representing him in this case. Indicates that he has not yet contacted Attorney Cockerham regarding this matter, but he was in contact with Attorney Wyshnytzky yesterday regarding other matters. State indicates that they have reached out to the firm and have not yet heard back. Court Commissioner's staff indicates that Attorney Wyshnytzky will cover the hearing tomorrow. Preliminary hearing remains on calendar.
No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.

1:37 PM Prosecuting attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Andrew Francis Pribula appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Ellen Denise Craker appeared by video for Andrew Francis Pribula. Defendant's address is verified. Attorney/Defendant acknowledges receipt of the complaint, waives a formal reading, enters pleas of not guilty to the misdemeanor count(s), and requests a preliminary hearing. State asks for $10,000 cash. No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription. Notes concerns over 6 pending bail jumping charges and 7 pending felony files in this county. Reviews previous bail amounts. Concerned over failure to follow court orders. Recites previous criminal history, warrants, and FTAs. Attorney Craker indicates that the defendant struggles with addiction and has worked closely with counsel. Has 1 previous conviction and expressed interest in treatment. Defendant is a local resident. Court notes concerns over number of open cases and possible potential penalties. Court orders $5,000 cash. No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 11:30 am.
